courses.name: Elementary Ancient Greek I
courses.description: Study of forms, grammar, syntax. Early attention to reading in simple Attic prose.

courses.name: Elementary Ancient Greek I - Honors
courses.description: Study of forms, grammar, syntax. Early attention to reading in simple Attic prose.

courses.name: Elementary Ancient Greek II
courses.description: Continuation of GREEK 1100. Readings in Attic prose.

courses.name: Elementary Ancient Greek II - Honors
courses.description: Continuation of GREEK 1100H. Readings in Attic prose.

courses.name: Greek Reading
courses.description: Selected works of Greek literature.

courses.name: Greek Reading - Honors
courses.description: Selected works of Greek literature.

courses.name: Intensive Beginning Greek II - Honors
courses.description: Continuation of GREEK 4110H. Attention to ability to read rapidly and accurately. Course meets five hours weekly for three hours credit.
courses.prerequisites: graduate standing and Honors eligibility required

courses.name: Intermediate Readings
courses.description: Selected advanced readings in prose and poetry. Introduction to Homer.

courses.name: The Greek New Testament
courses.description: (same as REL_ST 4650). Readings in the Greek New Testament and similar literature, e.g., the Septuagint. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Homer
courses.description: Reading, discussion, and literary analysis of Iliad and Odyssey.

courses.name: Greek Stylistics
courses.description: Study and practice of Greek prose, with special consideration to basic problems: abstract expression, word order, sentence structure and use of common rhetorical devices.

courses.name: Topics in Greek
courses.description: Topics course involving Greek texts. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Greek Tragedy
courses.description: Selected works of Aeschylus, Sophocles, Euripides, with special attention to language, style, ideas, and dramatic techniques.

courses.name: Greek Comedy
courses.description: Selected plays of Aristophanes and Menander, with special attention to cultural contexts.

courses.name: Greek Lyric Poetry
courses.description: Selected readings from lyric poets, with attention to verse forms, and dialects.

courses.name: Greek Oratory
courses.description: Selections from Greek orators, with emphasis on Lysias and Demosthenes.

courses.name: Greek Philosophers
courses.description: Emphasis on readings and analysis of selected texts of major Greek philosophers.

courses.name: Greek Historians
courses.description: Reading and analysis of selected texts of major Greek historians.

courses.name: Greek Epigraphy
courses.description: Introduction to study of Greek inscriptions and their contribution to the understanding of other aspects of ancient culture.

courses.name: Survey of Greek Literature
courses.description: Greek literature from origins to end of Roman period; emphasis on authors not covered in other courses, to provide general view of styles and genres.

courses.name: Special Readings in Greek
courses.description: Readings in authors and texts not covered in other courses.

courses.name: Intermediate Readings in Greek
courses.description: Selected advanced readings in prose and poetry. Introduction to Homer.
courses.prerequisites: GREEK 2000 or equivalent.  Available to students for graduate credit in departments other than Classical Studies

courses.name: The Greek New Testament
courses.description: (same as REL_ST 7650). Readings in the Greek New Testament and similar literature, e.g., the Septuagint. Graduate students read significantly more Greek than do undergraduates and testing is accordingly more rigorous. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Homer
courses.description: Reading, discussion, and literary analysis of Iliad and Odyssey.
courses.prerequisites: two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Stylistics
courses.description: Study and practice of general Greek prose tendencies, with special consideration to basic problems: abstract expression, word order, sentence structure and use of common rhetorical devices.

courses.name: Topics in Greek
courses.description: Organized study of selected authors or eras. Subject and earnable credit vary from semester to semester.
courses.prerequisites: two years of Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Tragedy
courses.description: Selected works of Aeschylus, Sophocles, Euripides, with special attention to language, style, ideas, and dramatic techniques.
courses.prerequisites: wo years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Comedy
courses.description: Selected plays of Aristophanes and Menander, with special attention to cultural contexts.
courses.prerequisites: two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Lyric Poetry
courses.description: Selected readings from lyric poets, with attention to verse forms, and dialects.
courses.prerequisites: two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Oratory
courses.description: Selections from Greek orators, with emphasis on Lysias and Demosthenes.
courses.prerequisites: two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Philosophers
courses.description: Emphasis on readings and analysis of selected texts of major Greek philosophers.
courses.prerequisites: two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Historians
courses.description: Reading and analysis of selected texts of major Greek historians.
courses.prerequisites: two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Greek Epigraphy
courses.description: Introduction to study of Greek inscriptions and their contribution to the understanding of other aspects of ancient culture.

courses.name: Survey of Greek Literature
courses.description: Greek literature from origins to end of Roman period; emphasis on authors not covered in other courses, to provide general view of styles and genres.
courses.prerequisites: two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Special Readings in Greek
courses.description: Readings in authors and texts not covered in other courses.
courses.prerequisites: departmental consent and two years Classical Greek or equivalent

courses.name: Proseminar in Greek Texts
courses.description: This is a seminar-level introduction to Greek literary and historical texts. The emphasis in this course will be on wide and intensive reading, with the objective of helping the new graduate student quickly develop a sound literary and linguistic competence.

courses.name: Greek Rough Guide
courses.description: Intensive exploration of Greek Literature from its earliest appearance through the Roman period.  Emphasis upon texts as both literary and cultural artifacts whose interpretation requires familiarity with the historical and archaeological legacy of antiquity as well as modern exegetical strategies.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Greek Historiography
courses.description: (same as HIST 8500). Study of the major contemporary historians of Classical Greece and their methodology. Differential readings available to both students with a reading knowledge of Greek and also those without Greek.

courses.name: Seminar in Greek Drama
courses.description: May be repeated to a maximum of 6 hours.

courses.name: Seminar in Greek Lyric Poetry
courses.description: Seminar in Greek Lyric Poetry.

courses.name: Seminar in the Greek Philosophers
courses.description: Seminar in the Greek Philosophers.

courses.name: Seminar in the Greek Historians
courses.description: Seminar in the Greek Historians.

courses.name: Seminar in Greek Epic Poetry
courses.description: Seminar in Greek Epic Poetry.

courses.name: Seminar on the Age of Pericles
courses.description: Study of Greek culture of mid-fifth century B.C., including law, religion, art, philosophy, science, and other aspects of the culture, to give students an integrated view of life of the period.

courses.name: Seminar in Special Fields
courses.description: Seminar in Special Fields.
